name: Carolina Agurto Gangas
sub_title: FONDECYT Postdoctoral fellow at Universidad de Chile

home.description: I am an ESO-Comité Mixto postdoctoral researcher in the Astronomy Department at Universidad de Chile. My main research interests focus on the early stages of protoplanetary disks, investigating both the characterization of the dusty envelope and the processes of dust growth within the disk by using sub-mm and mm wavelengths. Currently, I'm working in the gas and dust characterization of the ALMA Large Program AGE-PRO (the ALMA survey of Gas Evolution in PROtoplanetary disks).

papers.abstract: In my PhD project, we plan to explore grain growth by measuring β index in Class I protostars at different wavelengths, which will allow us to bridge the gap between the well studied Class II objects and the earlier stage. We propose a multiwavelength study of Class I protoplanetary disks in different star forming regions, in order to constrain the grain sizes in disk as well in the inner and outer region of envelopes. With the capabilities of ALMA, SMA and NOEMA this will be the first unbiased study of grain growth in Class I protostars with the highest angular resolution and sensitivity ever seen.

Star Tres was founded in 2013 by Javiera Rey, Karina Rojas and myself during our Bachelor (Universidad de Valparaíso). Star Tres is a digital initiative composed by a website, social media, and a YouTube channel. Our main goal is to be a reliable source of information with simple and engaging content for all astronomy-lover public. We also advocate gender equality in STEM and critical thinking in our society.
All of our content is in Spanish, to fill the lack of Latin American astronomy outreach initiatives on internet.
